description: 多益 TOEIC 常考句型及易錯文法資料庫

grammar.pattern: Noun/Verb/Adjective/Adjective+ness (詞性變化)
grammar.chinese: 詞性判斷：名詞、動詞、形容詞、副詞的正確位置
examples: The company's annual **shareholder** meeting will be held next Friday.
Our marketing team has been working **diligently** to prepare for the product launch.
The **implementation** of the new software system has significantly improved office productivity.
grammar.commonMistakes: 不要被字尾迷惑，如 -ly 結尾不一定是副詞（family 是名詞）

grammar.pattern: Subject-Verb Agreement (集合名詞/Each/There be)
grammar.chinese: 主詞動詞一致性：單複數與時態的連動陷阱
examples: The committee **is** scheduled to review the merger proposal tomorrow morning.
Each of the quarterly reports **contains** detailed financial analysis.
There **are** several important issues that need to be addressed.
grammar.commonMistakes: 集合名詞在商業語境中通常視為單數；不要被介系詞短語中的複數名詞迷惑

grammar.pattern: I/Me/My/Mine; Its/It's; Yourself/Themselves
grammar.chinese: 代名詞家族：主格、受格、所有格與反身代名詞的精準使用
examples: The project manager asked my colleague and **me** to prepare the presentation.
The company is proud of **its** commitment to environmental sustainability.
The sales team members congratulated **themselves** on achieving the highest results.
grammar.commonMistakes: its/it's 是最高頻混淆點；its 是所有格，it's 是 it is 的縮寫

grammar.pattern: Present Perfect vs Past Simple / Past Perfect
grammar.chinese: 動詞時態：現在完成式、過去簡單式與過去完成式的區別
examples: Our company **has made** significant progress in digital transformation since last year.
The financial director **had reviewed** the budget proposal before the meeting started.
We **have added** three major clients to our portfolio in the past six months.
grammar.commonMistakes: 不要見到過去時間就選過去式，要看動作與現在的關聯；注意 since/for/ago 的時態線索

grammar.pattern: be + Past Participle (can be done / has been done)
grammar.chinese: 主動與被動語態：判斷主詞是「做出動作」還是「接受動作」
examples: All employee contracts **must be reviewed** by the HR department.
The new marketing strategy **was developed** after extensive market research.
Customer feedback forms **have been processed** online since the company launched.
grammar.commonMistakes: 不要忽略情態動詞和完成式的被動形式

grammar.pattern: Verb + to do / Verb + doing
grammar.chinese: 不定詞與動名詞：決定動詞後面該接 To V 還是 V-ing
examples: The board decided **to implement** the expansion plan.
The marketing team suggested **using** social media advertising.
We appreciate **your informing** us about the changes.
grammar.commonMistakes: decide後接to V；suggest後接Ving；appreciate後接Ving；avoid/enjoy/mind後接Ving

grammar.pattern: V-ing (令人...) vs V-ed (感到...)
grammar.chinese: 分詞作為形容詞：現在分詞與過去分詞當形容詞使用
examples: The quarterly financial results were quite **encouraging**.
Many employees felt **excited** by the company's decision.
The presentation included several **surprising** statistics.
grammar.commonMistakes: 主詞是事物用V-ing(令人...)，主詞是人且表感受用V-ed(感到...)

grammar.pattern: Having + P.P. / Being + P.P. / V-ing
grammar.chinese: 分詞構句：如何簡化句子，展現高階寫作邏輯
examples: **Impressed** by the impressive sales figures, the management team approved additional funding.
**Having completed** the market research thoroughly, the product development team began designing.
The conference room was busy, with participants **reviewing** materials.
grammar.commonMistakes: 分詞構句的邏輯主詞必須與主句主詞一致；注意主動用V-ing，被動用V-ed

grammar.pattern: Although + S + V / Despite + N / Because + S + V / Because of + N
grammar.chinese: 連接詞 vs. 介系詞：搞懂 Although/Despite, Because/Because of 的區別
examples: **Despite** the challenging economic conditions, our company maintained steady growth.
The product launch was postponed **because** the marketing team needed more time.
**Due to** his extensive experience, Mr. Johnson was appointed as regional director.
grammar.commonMistakes: Although/Even though 後接完整子句；Despite/Due to 後接名詞片語

grammar.pattern: who/whom/which/that/whose + clause
grammar.chinese: 關係子句：Who, Which, That, Whose 的選擇與省略時機
examples: The consultant **whom** we hired from the Tokyo office has provided valuable insights.
The software program **whose** features include automated reporting has improved efficiency.
Employees **who** complete the training program by the deadline will receive a bonus.
grammar.commonMistakes: whose不僅用於人，也可用於物表示所屬關係；whom在口語中可省略

grammar.pattern: Adjective vs Adverb (quick/quickly)
grammar.chinese: 形容詞與副詞：釐清修飾對象
examples: The marketing presentation was delivered **remarkably** effectively.
After reviewing the proposals, the committee found them **surprisingly** comprehensive.
She speaks English **fluently** in international meetings.
grammar.commonMistakes: 不要看到 -ly 就認為是副詞；friendly, lovely, lonely 是形容詞

grammar.pattern: more + adj than / as + adj as / the most
grammar.chinese: 比較級與最高級：than, as...as, the most 的正確用法
examples: This project is **more challenging than** the previous one.
This is **the most comprehensive** report we have ever produced.
The new model performs **as well as** the old model in testing.
grammar.commonMistakes: 比較級修飾詞用 much/a lot/far；双重比较級要注意not any more

grammar.pattern: If + Past ..., would/could + V
grammar.chinese: 假設語氣：與現在/過去事實相反的虛擬情境
examples: **If** we **had** more time, we **would conduct** more thorough research.
**If** she **were** here, she **could help** us with the presentation.
I wish I **had** attended the conference last week.
grammar.commonMistakes: 與現在事實相反：用過去式；與過去事實相反：用過去完成式

grammar.pattern: 否定副詞 + 倒裝 (Never/Rarely/Seldom/Not only)
grammar.chinese: 倒裝句：否定副詞開頭的特殊句構
examples: **Never before** have we seen such impressive results.
**Rarely does** the company offer such a generous benefits package.
**Not only** did we meet the target, but we also exceeded expectations.
grammar.commonMistakes: 倒裝句中主詞和動詞順序顛倒；助動詞放在主詞前

grammar.pattern: much/many, few/little, a few/a little
grammar.chinese: 名詞與數量詞：可數與不可數名詞的搭配
examples: There is **much** work to be done before the deadline.
We have made **few** mistakes in this quarter.
We still have **a little** time to complete the project.
grammar.commonMistakes: much/many 用於否定/疑問句；few/little 表負面意涵；a few/a little 表正面

grammar.pattern: make/have/let + O + 原形動詞
grammar.chinese: 使役動詞：make, have, let 後接原形動詞
examples: My boss **made** me work overtime last week.
I **had** my sister help me with the project.
Let **me** help you carry the heavy boxes.
grammar.commonMistakes: 使役動詞後接原形動詞（不加 to）；have + O + p.p. 表「讓...被做」

grammar.pattern: see/watch/hear + O + V-ing / V原
grammar.chinese: 感官動詞：see, watch, hear, notice 後接 V-ing 或原形動詞
examples: I saw him **running** in the park this morning.
She watched the movie **last night**.
I heard him **singing** in the shower.
Did you notice anyone **enter** the office?
grammar.commonMistakes: V-ing 表正在進行；V原 表動作完整發生過

grammar.pattern: appear/seem/become + 形容詞
grammar.chinese: 連綴動詞：appear, seem, become 後接形容詞（不用副詞）
examples: The situation **seems** difficult to resolve.
The company **appears** confident about the future.
The demand **has become** increasingly high.
grammar.commonMistakes: 連綴動詞後接形容詞，不是副詞

grammar.pattern: in spite of / because of / due to / owing to
grammar.chinese: 介系詞片語：despite/due to/in spite of 的使用
examples: **In spite of** the rain, we held the outdoor event.
The delay was **due to** technical difficulties.
**Owing to** circumstances beyond our control, we had to cancel.
grammar.commonMistakes: due to / owing to / thanks to 通常作補語；in spite of / despite 後接名詞或V-ing

grammar.pattern: whoever/whatever/wherever + clause
grammar.chinese: 複合關係代名詞：whoever, whatever, whichever, wherever
examples: **Whatever** you decide, we will support your choice.
**Whoever** is responsible for this mistake will be held accountable.
You may choose **whichever** option suits you best.
grammar.commonMistakes: 複合關係代名詞本身已包含先行詞，不需要再加先行詞

grammar.pattern: We would like to / Please find attached / Kindly revert
grammar.chinese: 商用英文書信常用句型
examples: **We would like to** inform you that the meeting has been rescheduled.
**Please find attached** the report you requested.
**Kindly revert** at your earliest convenience.
grammar.commonMistakes: 商業書信中避免過度口語化；注意正式語氣

grammar.pattern: must/have to/should/ought to/could/may
grammar.chinese: 情態動詞：表義務、建議、可能性、推測
examples: You **must** submit the report by Friday.
You **should** consult with your manager before making a decision.
The project **could** be completed ahead of schedule.
grammar.commonMistakes: must 表主觀義務；have to 表客觀義務；should 表建議

grammar.pattern: both...and / either...or / neither...nor / not only...but also
grammar.chinese: 對等連接詞：both...and, either...or, neither...nor, not only...but also
examples: **Both** the CEO **and** the CFO attended the meeting.
**Either** you **or** I need to present the findings.
**Neither** the manager **nor** the staff were satisfied with the outcome.
grammar.commonMistakes: 注意鄰近原則：動詞應與最接近的主詞一致

grammar.pattern: a/an/the/零冠詞
grammar.chinese: 冠詞的使用：a, an, the, 零冠詞
examples: She is **a** university student studying business.
The United States is a major market for our products.
We meet **once a week** on Mondays.
grammar.commonMistakes: a 用於子音開頭；an 用於母音開頭；特定時用 the；抽象名詞/複數通常不加冠詞

grammar.pattern: She said (that) she was busy. / He told me (that) he would come.
grammar.chinese: 間接引語：引述句的時態變化
examples: He said (that) he **was** busy. (現在式→過去式)
She told me (that) she **would** attend the meeting. (will→would)
They mentioned that they **had finished** the project. (have→had)
grammar.commonMistakes: 主句動詞為過去式時，從句時態要「倒退一步」

grammar.pattern: If + Present..., will / Unless + 肯定 = If + 否定
grammar.chinese: 條件句：第一類條件句與 Unless 的使用
examples: **If** you **finish** the report today, we **will review** it tomorrow.
**Unless** you submit the application, you cannot attend the program.
If it **rains** tomorrow, the event will be postponed.
grammar.commonMistakes: Unless = If not，但語意略有不同

grammar.pattern: Would you mind + V-ing? / Could you please + V?
grammar.chinese: 請求與建議的正式用法
examples: **Would you mind** sending me the updated schedule?
**Could you please** clarify the requirements?
**I would recommend** contacting the supplier directly.
grammar.commonMistakes: Would you mind 後接 V-ing；Could you please 後接原形動詞

grammar.pattern: too + adj to V / adj + enough to V
grammar.chinese: Too...to 與 Enough...to 句型
examples: The report is **too complex to understand** without proper training.
She is **experienced enough to handle** the project independently.
The deadline is too tight for us to complete the work.
grammar.commonMistakes: too...to 表「太...而不能」；enough...to 表「足夠...可以」

grammar.pattern: It is/was + 強調部分 + that/who + 其餘
grammar.chinese: It 強調句：It is...that/who
examples: **It is** the marketing team **that** developed the new strategy.
**It was** last week **that** we signed the contract.
**It is** only by working together **that** we can succeed.
grammar.commonMistakes: 強調人時可用 who/that；強調其他用 that

grammar.category: 現在分詞與過去分詞當形容詞
grammar.pattern: interesting/interested, boring/bored, exciting/excited
grammar.chinese: 分詞形容詞：現在分詞與過去分詞的情感用法
examples: The presentation was **interesting** and kept everyone's attention.
Many participants were **interested** in learning more about the product.
The news was **exciting** for the entire team.
grammar.commonMistakes: V-ing 表「令人...的」（事物作主詞）；V-ed 表「感到...的」（人作主詞）

grammar.pattern: prior to / before / after / upon + V-ing
grammar.chinese: 時間順序表達：prior to, upon, after + V-ing
examples: **Prior to** making any decision, please consult the guidelines.
**Upon** receiving the approval, we will begin the implementation.
**After** reviewing the proposal, we found several issues.
grammar.commonMistakes: prior to / upon 後接 V-ing，等同於 before + 子句

grammar.pattern: however / nevertheless / whereas / while
grammar.chinese: 對照與轉折：however, whereas, while 的使用
examples: The new model is more expensive; **however**, it offers better performance.
**Whereas** the first quarter showed growth, the second quarter declined.
**While** some prefer online meetings, others favor face-to-face discussions.
grammar.commonMistakes: however 和 but 不能連用；however 可置句首/句中/句尾用分號隔開

grammar.pattern: so...that / such...that / therefore / consequently
grammar.chinese: 結果與程度：so that, such that, therefore, consequently
examples: The project was **so successful that** we exceeded all expectations.
**Such** was the demand **that** we had to increase production.
The server crashed; **therefore**, we lost some data.
grammar.commonMistakes: such + (a) adj + N + that；so + adj/adv + that

grammar.pattern: If possible / When convenient / Unless otherwise stated
grammar.chinese: 省略與簡化結構：常見商業省略用法
examples: Please send the report **if possible** by Friday.
We will contact you **when convenient** for a follow-up meeting.
All prices are subject to change **unless otherwise stated**.
grammar.commonMistakes: 省略句中保留了原句的含義，省略了主詞和be動詞

grammar.pattern: No + N / Not + V / Never / Rarely / Seldom
grammar.chinese: 否定句型的使用：no, not, never, rarely, seldom
examples: **No** changes will be made to the schedule.
We **do not** anticipate any delays in the project.
The company **rarely** experiences such technical issues.
grammar.commonMistakes: no + N = not a/not any；否定的倒裝句要小心主詞動詞順序

grammar.pattern: no more...than / not more...than / no less...than
grammar.chinese: 雙重比較結構：no more...than, not more...than
examples: This project is **no more important than** the previous one. (兩者都不重要)
She is **not more talented than** her colleague. (她不比同事有天賦)
This solution is **no less effective than** the alternative.
grammar.commonMistakes: no more...than = 兩者都否；not more...than = 程度較低

grammar.pattern: both...and / not only...but also +相同詞性
grammar.chinese: 平行結構：對等連接詞兩側需對等
examples: The job requires **creativity and analytical skills**.
We need to **reduce costs and improve efficiency**.
She is responsible for **managing the team and coordinating projects**.
grammar.commonMistakes: both A and B 中的 A 與 B 必須是相同詞性（名對名、動對動）

grammar.pattern: depend on / consist of / approve of / insist on
grammar.chinese: 介系詞固定搭配：常見動詞+介系詞組合
examples: The success of the project **depends on** effective communication.
The committee **consists of** five senior managers.
We **insist on** maintaining high quality standards.
grammar.commonMistakes: 注意每個動詞的特定介系詞搭配，不能混淆

grammar.pattern: need/want/require + V-ing (表被動)
grammar.chinese: 主動形式表被動意義：need, want, require + V-ing
examples: The car **needs washing** (= needs to be washed).
The report **requires reviewing** (= requires to be reviewed).
This job **wants doing** (= wants to be done).
grammar.commonMistakes: V-ing 主動形式表被動意義，等同於 to be p.p.

grammar.pattern: business meeting / credit card / phone number
grammar.chinese: 複合名詞：名詞作形容詞修飾另一名詞
examples: We have a **business meeting** scheduled for tomorrow.
Please provide your **credit card** information for payment.
The **phone number** is listed on our website.
grammar.commonMistakes: 複合形容詞通常用單數名詞（如 business meeting 非 businesses meeting）

grammar.pattern: be + V-ing (表未來計畫)
grammar.chinese: 進行式表未來：表已安排的未來計畫
examples: We **are meeting** with the client next Monday.
The CEO **is traveling** to Asia next week.
I **am attending** the conference tomorrow afternoon.
grammar.commonMistakes: be V-ing 表未來只用於已經安排好的計畫，非臨時決定

grammar.pattern: S + V, + don't/doesn't/didn't + S?
grammar.chinese: 附加問句：反問句的用法
examples: You have reviewed the report, **haven't you**?
She can't attend the meeting, **can she**?
They were satisfied with the results, **weren't they**?
grammar.commonMistakes: 附加問句的助動詞要看主要子句的時態和肯定/否定

grammar.pattern: Opinion-Size-Age-Shape-Color-Origin-Material-Purpose
grammar.chinese: 多個形容詞排列順序： opinion-size-age-shape-color-origin-material-purpose
examples: a beautiful new small round brown French wooden writing desk
an expensive old rectangular black American leather traveling bag
grammar.commonMistakes: 記住順序口訣：OSASCOMP（美麗的老小圓棕法木寫作桌）

grammar.pattern: N, N (同位語) / N, which/who...
grammar.chinese: 同位語：名詞或名詞片語進一步說明前面的名詞
examples: Mr. Johnson, **our new CEO**, has extensive experience in the industry.
The report, **which was completed yesterday**, shows positive results.
Tokyo, **the capital of Japan**, is a major business hub.
grammar.commonMistakes: 同位語可用逗號隔開，與關係子句類似但功能不同

grammar.pattern: It is + adj + to V / There is/are + N
grammar.chinese: 虛主詞 It/There：形式主詞與存在句
examples: **It is** important **to submit** the report on time.
**There is** no doubt that the project will succeed.
**It is** essential **that** the team work together.
grammar.commonMistakes: It is important that + S + (should) V 是建議性格氣動詞

grammar.pattern: would rather + V原 / would prefer + to V
grammar.chinese: would rather 與 would prefer 的用法
examples: I **would rather** stay at home than go to the party.
She **would prefer** to work from home on Fridays.
They **would rather** not discuss the sensitive topic.
grammar.commonMistakes: would rather 後接原形動詞；would prefer 後接 to + V

grammar.pattern: twice as adj as / three times the N of
grammar.chinese: 倍數表達：倍數的各種說法
examples: This building is **twice as tall as** that one.
Our sales are **three times what they were** last year.
The new model costs **twice the price of** the old one.
grammar.commonMistakes: 倍數表達：twice as...as / double / triple / times

grammar.pattern: although + S + V / despite + N / in spite of + N
grammar.chinese: 讓步狀語从句：although/despite/even though
examples: **Although** the weather was bad, we continued the outdoor event.
**Despite** the difficulties, we achieved our goals.
**Even though** she was busy, she managed to attend the meeting.
grammar.commonMistakes: although/even though 後接完整子句；despite/in spite of 後接名詞或V-ing

grammar.pattern: whether + to V / whether or not
grammar.chinese: whether 與 if 的用法區別
examples: I don't know **whether to accept** the job offer.
Please let me know **whether or not** you can attend.
The question is **whether** we should invest in new technology.
grammar.commonMistakes: whether 可以直接加 to V；if 不能；whether or not 不可寫成 if or not

grammar.pattern: should have p.p. / must have p.p. / can't have p.p.
grammar.chinese: 情態動詞表推測：對過去/現在的推測
examples: He **should have received** the email by now. (應該已收到)
She **must have forgotten** about the meeting. (肯定忘了)
They **can't have finished** the project already. (不可能已完成)
grammar.commonMistakes: should have p.p. 表「應該已經」；must have p.p. 表「肯定已經」；can't have p.p. 表「不可能已經」
